name: Dog Sprayed by Skunk
description: Steps to take if your dog gets sprayed by a skunk.
immediateActions: Keep your dog outside to prevent the odor from spreading indoors.
Check your dog's eyes. If they are red or irritated, flush them gently with cool water or a pet-safe eyewash.

steps.title: Gather Supplies
steps.details: You'll need: Rubber gloves, old towels, skunk shampoo (commercial or homemade). For homemade: 1 quart of 3% hydrogen peroxide solution, 1/4 cup baking soda, 1 teaspoon liquid dish soap. Mix just before use and do not store.

steps.title: Protect Yourself & Dog's Eyes
steps.details: Wear rubber gloves and old clothes. Before washing, you can apply a small strip of petroleum jelly or mineral oil around your dogâ€™s eyes to prevent shampoo from getting in.

steps.title: Wash Your Dog
steps.details: Wet your dog thoroughly. Lather with the skunk shampoo, avoiding eyes and mouth. Let the solution sit for 5-10 minutes before rinsing completely. Repeat if necessary.

steps.title: Rinse Thoroughly
steps.details: Rinse your dog extremely well. Any residue can irritate the skin.

steps.title: Towel Dry
steps.details: Dry your dog with old towels. Keep them warm.

steps.title: Clean Contaminated Items
steps.details: Wash any contaminated items (collars, leashes, your clothes) with a de-skunking solution or strong detergent.

steps.title: Monitor Your Dog
steps.details: Watch for any signs of illness, excessive drooling, or irritation. Contact your vet if you have concerns.

relevantContacts.name: Pet Poison Helpline (if ingested solution or severe reaction)

name: Found a Stray Animal
description: Guidance on what to do if you find a lost or stray pet.

steps.title: Approach Cautiously
steps.details: The animal may be scared or injured. Approach slowly, speak calmly, and avoid direct eye contact initially.

steps.title: Check for Identification
steps.details: Look for a collar with tags (name, phone number, rabies tag). If safe, try to contain the animal in a secure area (fenced yard, crate).

steps.title: Provide Water
steps.details: Offer fresh water. Avoid feeding immediately unless the animal appears emaciated, as it could cause digestive upset.

steps.title: Notify Local Shelters & Vets
steps.details: Contact San Diego Humane Society, County Animal Services, and local vet clinics. Provide a description, location found, and any ID info.

steps.title: Use Social Media & Online Lost Pet Finders
steps.details: Post on platforms like PawBoost, Petco Love Lost, Nextdoor, Facebook lost pet groups for San Diego.

steps.title: Scan for Microchip
steps.details: Take the animal to a vet clinic or shelter to be scanned for a microchip. This is a free service.
